lhm 1.0.0

Calculate the intrinsic growth rate

Source: R/rCalc.R
rCalc.Rd

A value for the intrinsic growth rate \(r\) is calculated using life-history data as a numerical solution to the Euler-Lotka equation.

Usage

rCalc(.Object, ...)

# S4 method for class 'lhm'
rCalc(.Object)

# S4 method for class 'lhmIter'
rCalc(.Object)

Arguments

.Object

an lhm object

...

additional arguments to generic function

Value

A prior class object containing a vector of values for \(r\).

Examples

# initialise lhm object
ainf <- 100
iter <- 1
rdat <- lhm(ainf,iter)

# assign life-history data
nmort(rdat)    <- list(mu=0.18)
size(rdat)     <- list(mu=list(Linf=106.5,k=0.229,t0=0.01)) 
mass(rdat)     <- list(mu=list(a=1.7e-9,b=3.328))
sr(rdat)       <- list(type='BH',mu=0.9)
maturity(rdat) <- list(mu=list(acrit=8))

# calculate r
r <- rCalc(rdat)
